title: update -r should may be more friendly and less scarry?
body:
I have a "partially" installed our super dataset, upgrade seems to require me to specify the sibling name (suboptimal) since I guess there is also other remotes (e.g. datalad-archives)

``` shell
(git)hopa:/tmp/datasets.datalad.org[master]
$> datalad update --merge -r
2016-09-20 10:54:14,651 [ERROR  ] No merge strategy for multiple remotes implemented yet. [update.py:__call__:11(venv-tests) 2 19554 ->1......(venv-tests) 2 195(ve(((((((venv-tests) 2 19554 

$> datalad update --merge -r origin
2016-09-20 10:54:26,393 [INFO   ] Updating dataset '/tmp/datasets.datalad.org' ... (update.py:115)
2016-09-20 10:54:26,416 [INFO   ] Applying changes from tracking branch... (update.py:144)

| Fast-forward

|  .datalad/meta/nidm/meta.json   |  6 ++-
|  dicoms                         |  2 +-
|  4 files changed, 97 insertions(+), 14 deletions(-)
|  (update.py:161)
```
